data.title: Lots of Surprising History and Artifacts
data.text: Plan to spend more time than you might think at this little museum.  Brings out the fascinating history of Sparks and the surrounding area and would be especiallly good for railroad buffs.  Also has interesting artifacts pertinent to local women.  Lots of nice restaurants close by.  Definitely worth a visit!

data.title: Great Mining and settlement history
data.text: Located in a neat bar and restaurant area with plenty of free parking garage parking just behind the businesses, the museum is a must to visit. See relics of the mining industry, the railroads and the lifestyles of early Nevada residents.

data.title: Mark Twains Pistol
data.text: We went to a seminar at the museum about the Virginia City "Duel that Never Was".  It took a little over an hour and was very interesting and entertaining.  The museum is planning on putting on a lecture the first Sat. of every month.  After the first one, I can highly recommend them.  Right now it's free.  If you wish to tour the museum there is a $5 fee.

data.title: A great little museum
data.text: Partner and I left the nugget casino near by to see what was around. We came across a steam engine and carriage from the southern pacific railway. Directly across the road is the museum. Having some time we entered and found a real little piece of Sparks. The volunteer staff are fab and friendly. The cost is $5. The display takes about 1 to 1.1/2 hours to view. They have a great selection of railway items from the start of the railway coming to Sparks in the 1800's to displays on early kitchen items, lounge room, gold rush. Items and the displays on the testing of the nasa rocket fuel and engines which occurred just outside Reno in the 1960's. So don't just hibernate your time at nuggets - a four minute stroll down the street is worth it

data.title: Worth a look inside
data.text: I was pleasantly surprised to see all the historical displays in this tiny museum. Lots of tidbits from history. The volunteer docents were helpful with questions. There is a huge Basque exhibit as well. Down-home, fun and friendly place.

data.title: small town museum
data.text: Sparks is a small town. So the museum is small too. They have some fun actives that everyone can enjoy.

data.title: Very Nice Look at local history
data.text:
The location has excellent parking. Old structures such as a depot, school house, and older buildings with distinctive architecture surround the neighborhood. 

 The museum exhibits are well laid out and explained through audio visual touch screens. Thoroughly enjoyable look at local history....the photos of the old gold miners are so vivid you can almost taste the sand in their beans!

data.title: I need to go back and see it all this time!
data.text: I have to admit, I sold this place short. It's a tiny museum, but there are literally thousands of artifacts jammed into this building as well as a 45 minute historic tour of several train cars that are parked across the street. Don't miss the tour, don't miss reading everything in the museum: toys, railroad buffs, you name it. What a gem!

data.title: GREAT RAILROAD MUSEUM IN SPARKS, NV
data.text: don't know why this is listed at lake Tahoe, but it is LOCATED ON VICTORIAN SQUARE IN SPARKS. very nice museum, with nice people. not big, but has a lot of items. if you can go on Saturday afternoon,  tour the full size train cars.

data.title: Nice Museum in Sparks, Nevada
data.text:
This is a nice local museum in Sparks, Nevada.  Its official name is Sparks Museum and Cultural Center. There are outside exhibits such as the railroad and the school house.

Inside the museum, there are various exhibits about local Sparks history, railroad history, and slot machines (i.e. they have one of those slots machines where you actually got a tiny amount of exercise as you had to pull the handle each time you played - they were also the type of machine that took real money.)

The volunteer staff here is very nice.  Two volunteers were there the day I visited and were most willing to answer any questions one  might have.  There is a small admission fee based on age - for adults the price is $5.  

The museum area takes about an hour to see (or a bit less).

There are two entrances - one entrance has stairs, the other entrance is accessible entrance to all.

data.title: A Compact Walk through the History of Sparks
data.text: This beautiful brick building was originally one of the well built Carnegie libraries.  It looks small from the outside, but the displays and walk through exhibits are wonderful, and worth at least a couple hours of your time.  About four years ago the upstairs was refinished and is a great space for art exhibits and private functions.  There are some nifty items for sale at the front desk.  I always take visitors to see this museum.  I am glad that while West Sparks oops I mean Reno tends to tear its historic buildings down, Sparks has a habit of recycling and reusing its historic structures.

data.title: Sparks Heritage Museum
data.text: The museum is about the Reno, Sparks area.  Sparks was set up over night by the Southern Pacific Railroad. In 1903 the population was 0.  In 1904 it was 1500.  How they did it was very interesting.   The people at the museum are friendly and try to answer any questions.  Try it I think you will like it.
